trans-unit.source: Preflight Table Request
trans-unit.target: Preflight Table Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Preflight Table Request</languageKeyword> operation queries the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for the Table service prior to sending the actual request.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Preflight Table Request</languageKeyword> operation queries the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for the Table service prior to sending the actual request.

trans-unit.source: A web browser or another user agent sends a preflight request that includes the origin domain, method, and headers for the actual request that the agent wishes to make.
trans-unit.target: A web browser or another user agent sends a preflight request that includes the origin domain, method, and headers for the actual request that the agent wishes to make.

trans-unit.source: If CORS is enabled for the Table service, then the Table service evaluates the preflight request against the CORS rules that the account owner has configured via <link xlink:href="aff6740b-6ea5-4548-b226-322eb76dad94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table Service Properties (REST API)</link>, and accepts or rejects the request.
trans-unit.target: If CORS is enabled for the Table service, then the Table service evaluates the preflight request against the CORS rules that the account owner has configured via <link xlink:href="aff6740b-6ea5-4548-b226-322eb76dad94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table Service Properties (REST API)</link>, and accepts or rejects the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information about CORS and the preflight request, see <externalLink><linkText>the CORS specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/</linkUri></externalLink> and <link xlink:href="a7d724fb-63f9-41e2-944e-23af461ec123" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information about CORS and the preflight request, see <externalLink><linkText>the CORS specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/</linkUri></externalLink> and <link xlink:href="a7d724fb-63f9-41e2-944e-23af461ec123" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</link>

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Preflight Table Request</languageKeyword> may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Preflight Table Request</languageKeyword> may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;table-resource%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the table resource that is to be the target of the actual request:
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;table-resource%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the table resource that is to be the target of the actual request:

trans-unit.source: HTTP Verb
trans-unit.target: HTTP Verb

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: OPTIONS
trans-unit.target: OPTIONS

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.
trans-unit.target: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.

trans-unit.source: In the case of this operation, the path portion of the URI can be empty, or can point to any table resource.
trans-unit.target: In the case of this operation, the path portion of the URI can be empty, or can point to any table resource.

trans-unit.source: The resource may or may not exist at the time the preflight request is made; the preflight request is evaluated at the service level against the service's CORS rules, so the presence or absence of the resource name does not affect the success or failure of the operation.
trans-unit.target: The resource may or may not exist at the time the preflight request is made; the preflight request is evaluated at the service level against the service's CORS rules, so the presence or absence of the resource name does not affect the success or failure of the operation.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the origin from which the actual request will be issued.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the origin from which the actual request will be issued.

trans-unit.source: The origin is checked against the service's CORS rules to determine the success or failure of the preflight request.
trans-unit.target: The origin is checked against the service's CORS rules to determine the success or failure of the preflight request.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the method (or HTTP verb) for the actual request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the method (or HTTP verb) for the actual request.

trans-unit.source: The method is checked against the service's CORS rules to determine the failure or success of the preflight request.
trans-unit.target: The method is checked against the service's CORS rules to determine the failure or success of the preflight request.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the headers for the actual request headers that will be sent, then the service assumes no headers are sent with the actual request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the headers for the actual request headers that will be sent, then the service assumes no headers are sent with the actual request.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>the CORS specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/</linkUri></externalLink> for details about preflight request headers.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>the CORS specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/</linkUri></externalLink> for details about preflight request headers.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
trans-unit.target: Access-Control-Allow-Origin

trans-unit.source: The allowed origin, which matches the origin header in the request if the preflight request succeeded.
trans-unit.target: The allowed origin, which matches the origin header in the request if the preflight request succeeded.

trans-unit.source: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
trans-unit.target: Access-Control-Allow-Methods

trans-unit.source: If the preflight requests succeeds, this header is set to the value or values specified for the request header Access-Control-Request-Method.
trans-unit.target: If the preflight requests succeeds, this header is set to the value or values specified for the request header Access-Control-Request-Method.

trans-unit.source: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
trans-unit.target: Access-Control-Allow-Headers

trans-unit.source: If the preflight request succeeds, this header is set to the value or values specified for the request header Access-Control-Request-Headers.
trans-unit.target: If the preflight request succeeds, this header is set to the value or values specified for the request header Access-Control-Request-Headers.

trans-unit.source: Access-Control-Max-Age
trans-unit.target: Access-Control-Max-Age

trans-unit.source: Specifies the length of time the user agent is allowed to cache the preflight request for future requests.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the length of time the user agent is allowed to cache the preflight request for future requests.

trans-unit.source: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials
trans-unit.target: Access-Control-Allow-Credentials

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the actual request can be made using credentials.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the actual request can be made using credentials.

trans-unit.source: This header is always set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This header is always set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Preflight Table Request</languageKeyword> operation authenticates any request that includes proper authentication headers or includes a shared access signature (SAS).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Preflight Table Request</languageKeyword> operation authenticates any request that includes proper authentication headers or includes a shared access signature (SAS).

trans-unit.source: Anonymous non-authenticated requests will also be processed regardless of whether the resource exists, since OPTIONS preflight requests are evaluated against the account service settings.
trans-unit.target: Anonymous non-authenticated requests will also be processed regardless of whether the resource exists, since OPTIONS preflight requests are evaluated against the account service settings.

trans-unit.source: Sample Request and Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Request and Response

trans-unit.source: The following example sends a preflight request for the origin <fictitiousUri>www.contoso.com</fictitiousUri>, with the request method set to <languageKeyword>PUT</languageKeyword> and the request headers set to <parameterReference>content-type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>accept</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The following example sends a preflight request for the origin <fictitiousUri>www.contoso.com</fictitiousUri>, with the request method set to <languageKeyword>PUT</languageKeyword> and the request headers set to <parameterReference>content-type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>accept</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The response indicates that CORS is enabled for the service, and that a CORS rule matches the preflight request.
trans-unit.target: The response indicates that CORS is enabled for the service, and that a CORS rule matches the preflight request.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: If CORS is enabled for the service and there is a CORS rule that matches the preflight request, the service responds to the preflight request with status code 200 (<languageKeyword>OK</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: If CORS is enabled for the service and there is a CORS rule that matches the preflight request, the service responds to the preflight request with status code 200 (<languageKeyword>OK</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: The response includes the required <parameterReference>Access-Control</parameterReference> headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes the required <parameterReference>Access-Control</parameterReference> headers.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the request will be billed.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the request will be billed.

trans-unit.source: If CORS is not enabled or no CORS rule matches the preflight request, the service responds with status code 403 (<languageKeyword>Forbidden</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: If CORS is not enabled or no CORS rule matches the preflight request, the service responds with status code 403 (<languageKeyword>Forbidden</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: In this case, the request will not be billed.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the request will not be billed.

trans-unit.source: If the OPTIONS request is malformed, the service responds with status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>) and the request is not billed.
trans-unit.target: If the OPTIONS request is malformed, the service responds with status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>) and the request is not billed.

trans-unit.source: An example of a malformed request is one that doesn’t contain the required <parameterReference>Origin</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Access-Control-Request-Method</parameterReference> headers.
trans-unit.target: An example of a malformed request is one that doesn’t contain the required <parameterReference>Origin</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Access-Control-Request-Method</parameterReference> headers.

trans-unit.source: Note that the preflight request is a mechanism to query the CORS capability of a storage service associated with a certain storage account.
trans-unit.target: Note that the preflight request is a mechanism to query the CORS capability of a storage service associated with a certain storage account.

trans-unit.source: The preflight request is not targeted to a specific resource.
trans-unit.target: The preflight request is not targeted to a specific resource.
